Key Arguments: The legislation is described as draconian and dystopian, aimed at stifling free speech.
The bill gives the government totalitarian powers to suppress dissent.
Existing laws already address issues like hate speech and discrimination.
The government and mainstream media are major sources of misinformation.
The government exempts itself and foreign entities from the legislation.
The government's handling of COVID-19 is cited as an example of misinformation.
The bill is seen as a tool to suppress criticism and dissent against the government.
Main Themes: Exemptions and double standards in legislation
Notable Quotes: The reality is that this bill is designed to give the government totalitarian powers to crush freedom of speech.
Governments, along with their mainstream media allies, are also by far the biggest disseminators of misinformation and disinformation in the country.
The way to attack bad information is with good information, with unassailable facts and superior logic.
